trans-unit.source: Controls deserialization by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> class.

During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization that is derived from the abstract XmlSerializationReader class.

XmlSerializationReader is also implemented within the .NET Framework for deserialization of XML documents into <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument> and <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> objects.
You should not derive classes from XmlSerializationReader.
Instead, call one of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize%2A> methods.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader"></xref> class.
To be added.
To be added.
Stores an implementation of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback"></xref> delegate and its input data for a later invocation.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization that derives from <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader>.
During this process, the .NET Framework generates read methods that implement the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback> delegate.
It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized through SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements.
Next, as necessary, a read method is called during deserialization.
You should not directly create an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback> class.
The name of the .NET Framework type that is being deserialized.
The namespace of the .NET Framework type that is being deserialized.
The <xref:System.Type> to be deserialized.
An <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback"></xref> delegate.

Stores an object that is being deserialized from a SOAP-encoded <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element for later access through the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.GetTarget*> method.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times by `ref` attributes (or `href` attributes in SOAP 1.1) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
The value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_id" name="id" href=""></xref> attribute of a <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element that identifies the element.
The object that is deserialized from the XML element.
Checks whether the deserializer has advanced.
The current <xref uid="langword_csharp_count" name="count" href=""></xref> in a while loop.
The current <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.ReaderCount*>.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.ReaderCount*> has not advanced.
Removes all occurrences of white space characters from the beginning and end of the specified string.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The string that will have its white space trimmed.
The trimmed string.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that an object being deserialized should be abstract.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended only for use by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The name of the abstract type.
The .NET Framework namespace of the abstract type.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Populates an object from its XML representation at the current location of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>, with an option to read the inner element.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The local name of the derived XML Schema data type.
The namespace of the derived XML Schema data type.
The local name of the base XML Schema data type.
The namespace of the base XML Schema data type.
The namespace of the derived .NET Framework type.
The name of the base .NET Framework type.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that an object being deserialized cannot be instantiated because the constructor throws a security exception.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The name of the type.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that an object being deserialized cannot be instantiated because there is no constructor available.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The name of the type.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidCastException> that indicates that an explicit reference conversion failed.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The <xref:System.Type> that an object cannot be cast to.
This type is incorporated into the exception message.
The object that cannot be cast.
This object is incorporated into the exception message.
An <xref:System.InvalidCastException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidCastException> that indicates that an explicit reference conversion failed.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The <xref:System.Type> that an object cannot be cast to.
This type is incorporated into the exception message.
The object that cannot be cast.
This object is incorporated into the exception message.
A string identifier.
An <xref:System.InvalidCastException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that a derived type that is mapped to an XML Schema data type cannot be located.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The local name of the XML Schema data type that is mapped to the unavailable derived type.
The namespace of the XML Schema data type that is mapped to the unavailable derived type.
The full name of the .NET Framework base type for which a derived type cannot be located.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that a SOAP-encoded collection type cannot be modified and its values cannot be filled in.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The fully qualified name of the .NET Framework type for which there is a mapping.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that an enumeration value is not valid.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The enumeration value that is not valid.
The enumeration type.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that the current position of <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> represents an unknown XML node.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Creates an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> that indicates that a type is unknown.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> that represents the name of the unknown type.
An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether XML strings are translated into valid .NET Framework type names.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlConvert.EncodeName%2A> method writes valid XML from invalid sources.
For example, the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.ColumnName%2A> property of the <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> class can contain spaces, which are invalid as XML.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlConvert.DecodeName%2A> reads the encoded XML and restores it to the original value.
However, the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema.Read%2A> method of the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema> class cannot read such encoded XML.
In that case, set the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationWriter.EscapeName%2A> property to `false` to disable the encoding of the XML.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if XML strings are decoded into valid .NET Framework type names; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the XML document object into which the XML document is being deserialized.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> that represents the deserialized <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> data.
Ensures that a given array, or a copy, is large enough to contain a specified index.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The <xref:System.Array> that is being checked.
The required index.
The <xref:System.Type> of the array's elements.
The existing <xref:System.Array>, if it is already large enough; otherwise, a new, larger array that contains the original array's elements.
Fills in the values of a SOAP-encoded array whose data type maps to a .NET Framework reference type.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The FixupArrayRefs method implements the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate for deserialization of SOAP-encoded XML data.

While deserializing XML documents into .NET Framework objects, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically creates an instance of the FixupArrayRefs method for SOAP-encoded arrays whose data types map to .NET Framework reference types.
The method then is called by <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> to fill in the objects in the array.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
An object that contains the array whose values are filled in.
Gets the length of the SOAP-encoded array where the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is currently positioned.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The GetArrayLength method applies to the `arrayType` attribute that is used with SOAP encoding and specified with the namespace "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/".
The local name that the array should have.
The namespace that the array should have.
The length of the SOAP array.
Determines whether the XML element where the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is currently positioned has a null attribute set to the value <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is currently positioned over a null attribute with the value <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Gets an object that is being deserialized from a SOAP-encoded <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element and that was stored earlier by <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.AddTarget*>.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
The value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_id" name="id" href=""></xref> attribute of a <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element that identifies the element.
An object to be deserialized from a SOAP-encoded <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element.
Gets the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_xsi:type" name="xsi:type" href=""></xref> attribute for the XML element at the current location of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The `type` attribute from the instance of the XML Schema namespace explicitly specifies the data type of an XML element.
An XML qualified name that indicates the data type of an XML element.
Initializes callback methods that populate objects that map to SOAP-encoded XML data.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization that is derived from <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader>.
During this process, the .NET Framework generates read methods that implement the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback> delegate.
It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized through SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements.
Next, as necessary, a read method is called during deserialization.
The abstract InitCallbacks method is where the temporary derived class creates an instance of and initializes read callback methods.
You should not directly create an instance of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback>.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
Stores element and attribute names in a <xref:System.Xml.NameTable> object.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The InitIDs method is abstract.
Gets or sets a value that should be <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> for a SOAP 1.1 return value.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, if the value is a return value.
Determines whether an XML attribute name indicates an XML namespace.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
An attribute name indicates an XML namespace if it takes the form `xmlns:``key`, where "key" is the namespace name.
The name of an XML attribute.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true " name="true " href=""></xref>if the XML attribute name indicates an XML namespace; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Sets the value of the XML attribute if it is of type <xref uid="langword_csharp_arrayType" name="arrayType" href=""></xref> from the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) namespace.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
WSDL uses the namespace "http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/".
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlAttribute"></xref> that may have the type <xref uid="langword_csharp_wsdl:array" name="wsdl:array" href=""></xref>.
Makes the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> read the fully qualified name of the element where it is currently positioned.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The fully qualified name of the current XML element.
Makes the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> read an XML end tag.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
Gets the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object that is being used by <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader"></xref>.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> that is being used by the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader"></xref>.
Gets the current count of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
The method is used by generated classes and should not be directly invoked.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> uses an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> class to count when a read operation occurs.
The count is incremented each time the reader calls an appropriate method, for example the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Read%2A> method or the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadElementString%2A> method.
The current count of an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
Instructs the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read the current XML element if the element has a null attribute with the value true.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element has a **null="true"** attribute value and has been read; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Instructs the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read the fully qualified name of the element where it is currently positioned.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

A <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> that represents the fully qualified name of the current XML element; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if a **null="true"** attribute value is present.
Instructs the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read a simple, text-only XML element that could be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The string value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

Reads the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_href" name="href" href=""></xref> attribute (<xref uid="langword_csharp_ref" name="ref" href=""></xref> attribute for SOAP 1.2) that is used to refer to an XML element in SOAP encoding.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The opening `#` symbol is stripped from the `href` attribute value.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
An output string into which the <xref uid="langword_csharp_href" name="href" href=""></xref> attribute value is read.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the value was read; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Deserializes an object from a SOAP-encoded <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> XML element.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The ReadReferencedElement method obtains the XML Schema data type by reading the `xsi:type` attribute of the `multiRef` element.
The prefix `xsi` refers to the instance of the XML Schema namespace.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
The value of the referenced element in the document.
Deserializes an object from a SOAP-encoded <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> XML element.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

This signature of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader.ReadReferencedElement%2A> method obtains the XML Schema data type of the `multiRef` element from the method parameters rather than by reading the `xsi:type` attribute.
The prefix `xsi` refers to the instance of the XML Schema namespace.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
The local name of the element's XML Schema data type.
The namespace of the element's XML Schema data type.
The value of the referenced element in the document.
Deserializes objects from the SOAP-encoded <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> elements in a SOAP message.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
Deserializes an object from an XML element in a SOAP message that contains a reference to a <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
An output string into which the <xref uid="langword_csharp_href" name="href" href=""></xref> attribute value is read.
The deserialized object.
Deserializes an object from an XML element in a SOAP message that contains a reference to a <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element.

The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.

The namespace of the element's XML Schema data type.
An output string into which the <xref uid="langword_csharp_href" name="href" href=""></xref> attribute value is read.
The deserialized object.
Deserializes an object from an XML element in a SOAP message that contains a reference to a <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
The local name of the element's XML Schema data type.
The namespace of the element's XML Schema data type.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element name is also the XML Schema data type name; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
An output string into which the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_href" name="href" href=""></xref> attribute is read.
The deserialized object.
Populates an object from its XML representation at the current location of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
An <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable> that corresponds to the current position of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
An object that implements the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable> interface with its members populated from the location of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
This method supports the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
An IXmlSerializable object that corresponds to the current position of the XMLReader.
Specifies whether the serializable object is wrapped.
An object that implements the IXmlSerializable interface with its members populated from the location of the XmlReader.
Produces the result of a call to the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadString*> method appended to the input value.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
A string to prefix to the result of a call to the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadString*> method.
The result of call to the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadString*> method appended to the input value.
Returns the result of a call to the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.ReadString*> method of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> class, trimmed of white space if needed, and appended to the input value.
A string that will be appended to.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the result of the read operation should be trimmed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The result of the read operation appended to the input value.
Reads an XML element that allows null values (<xref uid="langword_csharp_xsi:nil = 'true'" name="xsi:nil = 'true'" href=""></xref>) and returns a generic <xref:System.Nullable%601> value.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> that represents the simple data type for the current location of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
A generic <xref:System.Nullable%601> that represents a null XML value.
Gets the value of the XML node at which the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> is currently positioned.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> that represents the simple data type for the current location of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
The value of the node as a .NET Framework value type, if the value is a simple XML Schema data type.
Instructs the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read an XML document root element at its current position.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the method should read content only after reading the element's start element; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDocument"></xref> that contains the root element that has been read.
Instructs the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> to read the XML node at its current position.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to read content only after reading the element's start element; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Stores an object to be deserialized from a SOAP-encoded <xref uid="langword_csharp_multiRef" name="multiRef" href=""></xref> element.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
SOAP encoding allows a unique XML element to appear once within a SOAP message as a `multiRef` element identified by an `id` attribute.
The `id` value can be referenced multiple times using `href` attributes (or `ref` attributes in SOAP 1.2) in substitute elements.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
The object to be deserialized.
Gets a dynamically generated assembly by name.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The ResolveDynamicAssembly method is static.
The full name of the assembly.
A dynamically generated <xref:System.Reflection.Assembly>.
Ensures that a given array, or a copy, is no larger than a specified length.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.
The array that is being checked.
The maximum length of the array.
The <xref:System.Type> of the array's elements.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> for the array, if present for the input array, can be returned; otherwise, a new, smaller array.
The existing , if it is already small enough; otherwise, a new, smaller array that contains the original array's elements up to the size of length.

Raises an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnknownAttribute> event for the current position of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.

The object being deserialized.
A comma-delimited list of XML qualified names.
Raises an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnreferencedObject> event for the current position of the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.

The protected members of <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> are intended for use only by derived classes that are used internally within the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure.

SOAP encoding, as specified in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification, allows for elements referenced multiple times in a SOAP message (or optionally, just once) to be referred by an `href` attribute in the main message.
An <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnreferencedObject> event occurs when such an element appears, but there is no `href` reference to it.

Add a handler method to <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnreferencedObject> to provide custom handling for unreferenced objects while the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> executes its <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method.
A unique string that is used to identify the unreferenced object, subsequently accessible through the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs.UnreferencedId*> property.

An object that the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> is attempting to deserialize, subsequently accessible through the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs.UnreferencedObject*> property.
